iktor Frankenstein has always dreamed of discovering the secret of

experiences, such as the incredible discovery among the shake-and-snow
paperweights, romance across the countertop, a surprise result from a
free perfume sample, and more.

A fictionalized account of the Persian Gulf War follows the adventures
of a USAF Lieutenant Colonel who wants to make peace with himself and
a helicopter pilot who must choose between her army career and the man
she loves. Reprint.

Investigating the death of a high-profile senator who died of a heart
attack while in bed with his mistress, Lieutenant Ben Tolliver hopes
for a quiet resolution to the case, until witnesses begin to be
murdered. Reprint.

book_title: The Gainesville Ripper: A Summer's Madness, Five Young Victims-The Investigation, the Arrest and the Trial (St Martin's True Crime Library)
Summary:
Terrorized by an unknown serial killer, the students at the University
of Florida lived in fear.

book_title: Bad Blood: The Shocking True Story Behind the Menendez Killings (St. Martin's true crime library)
Summary:
Chronicles the controversial trial of Lyle and Erik Menendez, two
California men accused of murdering their movie executive father,
Jose, and their mother, Kitty, in cold blood. Original.

The story of a platinum country music star recounts her humble
beginnings on the Oklahoma rodeo circuit, her Hollywood performances
beside Kenny Rogers and Burt Reynolds, and the tragic plane crash that
took the lives of her entire band.

Forty years after having an affair with an Italian princess married to
a rich American, Australian Bryan Cavanaugh is reunited with her and
discovers that his son is an important Vatican bishop

Nursing a wounded stranger back to health in her Yosemite Valley home,
naturalist's daughter Scotty MacDowell is swept up by her feelings
for him, until she learns of his plans to take away her homeland.

The fourth in a series of whimsical parodies offers a new collection
of offbeat advice from the author of More Life's Little
Destruction Book and Life's Little Frustration Book. Original.

book_title: The Apothecary Rose : An Owen Archer Mystery (An Owen Archer Mystery)
Summary:
Medieval detective Owen Archer must investigate a fatal medicine
administered to the English Lord Chancellor by the Master Apothecary
and resist loving a prime suspect, the apothecary's wife

Hoping to get a new book published, burned-out journalist Rosalind
Leigh interviews Olive Martin, an obsessed sculptor who is convicted
of killing her mother, and whom Rosalind begins to believe is not the
actual murderer. Reprint.

Moving into the renovated former ghost town of Pin+A1on Rim, fourteen-
year-old Bryce Willems encounters a vengeful Indian spirit who
promises him his heart's desires while plotting to destroy him and
his family. A first novel. Reprint.

book_title: On Call: Three Doctors on the Front Lines
Summary:
The case stories of three inner-city Boston physicians describes their
everyday battles to save lives and reveals the obstacles that each had
to overcome in order to become doctors and balance their private and
professional lives.

book_title: The Dodge City Trail (Trail Drive Series, No 8)
Summary:
Returning home after the Civil War, Texas rancher Dan Ember and his
neighbors find that their only chance of survival is a dangerous
cattle drive north across the Llano, an area overrun with killers,
gunslingers, and Quanah Parker's ...

In a true story of crime, guilt, and conscience, a model FBI
agent's illicit involvement with an informant leads him to commit
a crime that reveals the dark side of the FBI.

Leaving his home and wife for a tour of duty in Vietnam that could
place him in a commander's position, Lt. Brian Holcomb witnesses
his crew falling into drug-induced recklessness and faces an explosive
showdown. Reprint.

book_title: The Man Who Invented Florida (A Doc Ford Novel)
Summary:
Working off the shores of Southwest Florida, marine biologist Doc Ford
becomes involved with a woman sailor, his uncle claims to have
discovered the Fountain of Youth, and the law descends in search of
three missing men. Reprint. NYT.

Desperately wishing to travel back in time and avert the tragic curse
that has haunted the Windsor family since the Civil War and claimed
the life of her friend, Lindsey Callahan finds her unlikely wish
coming true. Original.

book_title: Murder in the East Room: An Eleanor Roosevelt Mysstery
Summary:
In the wake of war and her husband's challenging third term, first
lady Eleanor Roosevelt investigates the murder of Senator Vance
Gibson, a womanizer who is reputed to have had an affair with Greta
Garbo. Reprint.

A financial adviser and former credit-card junkie presents her secrets
for regaining control, repaying debt quickly, avoiding common
mistakes, and managing self-employment, bankruptcy, and credit
problems. Original.

Full of twists and turns right up to the very end, The Indictment is a
tale that crackles with electricity, and is impossible to put down.

She had to lose everything-even her life-to find out where her heart
truly belonged.

book_title: Louisiana Blue : A Tiller Galloway Underwater Thriller (A Tiller Galloway Thriller)
Summary:
In the unforgettable tradition of Clive Cussler and John D. MacDonald,
bestselling author David Poyer bring you to the depths of terror with
his breathless scenes of undersea adventure.

Setting off on a daring rescue mission, the beautiful warrior Alena is
haunted by strange dreams about a bejeweled island and a dragon and
finds her only hope in exiled sorcerer Galen Radbourne. Original.

book_title: Beyond Jennifer & Jason: An Enlightened Guide to Naming Your Baby
Summary:
But then Beyond Jennifer & Jason-- the first enlightened guide to
naming your baby-- was born, to tell parents-to-be what they really
want to know: which names are hot, and which names are on their way up
or down.

A recreation of the grandeur of ancient Egypt follows the fortunes of
the clever and scheming eunuch Taita; the beautiful Lostris, a
lord's daughter; and Tanus, an ambitious soldier. Reissue.

book_title: Blood at Fort Bridger (Forts of Freedom, Vol 4)
Summary:
One-eyed Pete Riley, a former mountain man who blacksmiths at an
important pioneer stop at Fort Bridger, Wyoming, is unwilling to
overlook the murders of innocent Shoshoni villagers after an attack on
the fort. Original.

Four short romances feature Celtic love and Irish luck, and include
Raine Cantrell's "The Bride's Gift," Emma
Merritt's "Green Willow," Bonnie Pega's "The
Lady in Green," and Marylyle Rogers's "The Fairy's
Tale." Original.

Charged with the first mission of a sophisticated destroyer that
carries a top-secret computer, Dan Lenson is caught in a web of
betrayal that is made up of a sinister computer virus and a
sailor's controversial suicide. Reprint.

book_title: The Essential Guide to Psychiatric Drugs : Includes The Most Recent Information On: Antidepressants, Tranquilizers and Antianxiety Drugs, Antipsychoti ... h More (Essential Guide to Psychiatric Drugs)
Summary:
An informative and easily accessible source of information about all
the psychiatric medications available today encompasses their uses,
side-effects, cost, dosage, and more, teaching consumers to take an
active role in their mental health.

book_title: The Lady Chapel : Devilish Deception And Unholy Murder Put Owen Archer On A Bloody Trail Through The Cloisters. (An Owen Archer Mystery)
Summary:
Investigating the murder of a wool merchant during the summer Feast of
Corpus Christi in 1363, Owen Archer learns that a second murder has
taken place and must call on his wife's apothecary skills to
unveil a web of treachery. Reprint.

book_title: Never Fade Away : The Kurt Cobain Story
Summary:
Examining an artisitic genius who was light years ahead of his time,
this is an unfailing account of Nirvana's rise and Cobain eventual
descent.

The television celebrity recounts her search for her husband, who
disappeared while mountain climbing

But was Damien spinning a web of deceit and treason, as he brought her
to his surfswept castle? From London's glitter to the dangerous
decadence of Napoleon's Paris, Kat Martin will dazzle you with her
riches, most sensuous romance ever!

book_title: Silent Witness: The True Story of a Psychic Detective
Summary:
Presents the true story of a psychic detective who emerged from her
suburban homemaker life when she realized that her powers could help
police track down criminals and describes the cases in which she
played a pivotal role. Reprint.

book_title: Cooking With the Dead/Recipes and Stories from Fans on the Road
Summary:
A culinary tour describes how loyal Grateful Dead fans have earned
money on the road by preparing and selling vegetarian food from the
backs of their vehicles and presents a variety of healthy, parking-lot
delicacies. Original.

book_title: The Concrete Blonde (A Harry Bosch Novel)
Summary:
Detective Harry Bosch had thought that he had eliminated the
"Dollmaker," a vicious serial killer, until he discovers
that he had killed the wrong man, and now Harry must find the
"Dollmaker" before he strikes again. Reissue. K.

Four women, friends at Sarah Lawrence College in the late 1950s, go
through love, careers, marriage, children, divorce, friendship, and
success as they grow to maturity

An exciting collection of romantic stories, all of which take place on
a magical midsummer night, from several of today's top historical
writers includes the works of Elaine Coffman, Alexis Harrington, Jill
Barnett, and Sonia Simone.

Meeting again at their twenty-fifth anniversary class reunion, three
friends, a divorced TV journalist, a high-powered CEO, and an English
teacher come up with the idea to spend one last carefree summer on the
road together. Reprint.

Chronicles the criminal career of Jill Coit, a sultry Southern beauty
who preyed on eligible, wealthy men and left a twisted trail of ten
marriages, bigamy, betrayal, adultery, and murder across at least five
states. Reissue.

book_title: Fallen Hero/the Shocking True Story Behind the O.J. Simpson Tragedy
Summary:
Looks at the double murder of Nicole Simpson and Ronald Goldman and
discusses the murder charge and attempted flight of O.J. Simpson.

When Willie Moore, an Alcatraz inmate who has just spent three years
in solitary confinement in total darkness for a failed escape attempt,
kills another prisoner, his court-appointed lawyer, Henry Davidson,
who is defending his first case, ...

book_title: Whatever Mother Says: An Incredible True Story of Death and Destruction Inside One Ordinary      Family (St. Martin's True Crime Library)
Summary:
A story of jealousy and obsession reveals how a deranged mother
plotted with her two grown sons to abuse, imprison, and murder their
two young sisters, crimes that only came to light due to the desperate
efforts of a third sister.

book_title: The Heart of Justice (Heart of Justice)
Summary:
He fought his way up from his working-class Irish roots to the Federal
bench. Tough and honest, dedicated to the law, he relishes sitting on
the case before to rival some of America's biggest corporate
takeovers. The heart of justice.

Searching for the resting place of a Revolutionary War hero at Brown
Spring Cemetery, the ladies of the Old Orchard Fort chapter of the DAR
discover a murdered body among the graves and launch a personal
investigation. Reprint.
White Shark is Peter Benchley at his best. Read it at your own risk.
